variable.name: A1A
variable.description: Have you ever had a time in your life when you felt sad, blue, or depressed for two weeks or more in a row? (African American participants)

variable.name: A1B
variable.description: Have you ever had a time in your life lasting two weeks or more when you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure? (African American participants)

variable.name: A1C
variable.description: How much of the day did these feelings usually last? (African American participants)

variable.name: A1D
variable.description: Did you feel this way: please think of two-week period in your life when your feelings of depression or loss of interest were worst (every day, almost every day, less often). (African American participants)

variable.name: A2
variable.description: Did you feel more tired out or low on energy than is usual for you? (African American participants)

variable.name: A3
variable.description: Did you gain or lose weight without trying, or did you stay about the same weight? (African American participants)
variable.value: Stayed about the same or on a diet

variable.name: A3AA
variable.description: About how much weight did you gain? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of pounds, -1, -2

variable.name: A3AB
variable.description: About how much weight did you lose? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of pounds, -1, -2

variable.name: A3ACGAIN
variable.description: (Gained): about how much weight did you gain and lose? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of pounds, -1, -2

variable.name: A3ACLOST
variable.description: (Lost): about how much weight did you gain and lose? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of pounds, -1, -2

variable.name: A4
variable.description: Did you have more trouble falling asleep than you usually do? (African American participants)

variable.name: A4A
variable.description: How often did that happen? (African American participants)

variable.name: A5
variable.description: Did you have a lot more trouble concentrating than usual? (African American participants)

variable.name: A6
variable.description: People sometimes feel down on themselves, no good, or worthless. Did you feel this way? (African American participants)

variable.name: A7
variable.description: Did you think a lot about death - either your own, someone else's, or death in general? (African American participants)

variable.name: A8
variable.description: About how many weeks altogether did you feel this way? Count the weeks before, during and after the worst two weeks. The total period of depression/loss of interest was. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of weeks, -1, -2

variable.name: A8A
variable.description: How many periods like this did you have in your life, lasting two or more weeks? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of periods, -1, -2

variable.name: A8B
variable.description: About how old were you the FIRST time you had a period of two weeks like this? (Whether or not you received any help for it?) Years of age when you first felt this way. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for age in years -1, -2

variable.name: A8C
variable.description: About how old were you the LAST time you had a period of two weeks like this? (Whether or not you received any help for it?) Years of age when the most recent episode happened. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for age in years -1, -2

variable.name: A8D
variable.description: Did you ever tell a professional about these problems (medical doctor, psychologist, social worker, counselor, nurse, clergy, or other helping professional)? (African American participants)

variable.name: A8E
variable.description: Did you take medication or use drugs or alcohol more than once for these problems? (African American participants)

variable.name: A8F
variable.description: How much did these problems (feeling depression or loss of interest) interfere with your life or activities? (A lot, some, a little, not at all). (African American participants)

variable.name: B1
variable.description: Have you ever have a period lasting one month or longer when most of the time you felt worried, tense, or anxious? (African American participants)

variable.name: B10
variable.description: How often did you find it difficult to control your worry? (African American participants)

variable.name: B12_1
variable.description: When you were worried or anxious, were you also restless? (African American participants)

variable.name: B12_2
variable.description: When you were worried or anxious, were you also "keyed up or on edge"? (African American participants)

variable.name: B12_3
variable.description: When you were worried or anxious, were you also "easily tired"? (African American participants)

variable.name: B12_4
variable.description: When you were worried or anxious, were you also having difficulty keeping your mind on what you were doing? (African American participants)

variable.name: B12_5
variable.description: When you were worried or anxious, were you also more irritable than usual? (African American participants)

variable.name: B12_6
variable.description: When you were worried or anxious, were you also having tense, sore, or aching muscles? (African American participants)

variable.name: B12_7
variable.description: When you were worried or anxious, were you also often having trouble falling or staying asleep? (African American participants)

variable.name: B14
variable.description: Did you ever tell a professional about these problems (medical doctor, psychologist, social worker, counselor, nurse, clergy, or other helping professional)? (African American participants)

variable.name: B15
variable.description: Did you take medication or use drugs or alcohol more than once for the worry or the problems it was causing? (African American participants)

variable.name: B16
variable.description: How much did the worry or anxiety interfere with your life or activities? (African American participants)

variable.name: B1A
variable.description: People differ a lot in how much they worry about things. Did you ever have a time when you worried a lot more than most people would in your situation? (African American participants)

variable.name: B2LIFE
variable.description: If no value to B2YEARS (variable) or B2MONTH (variable): all of my life/as long as I can remember? (African American participants)
variable.value: No all of my life/as long as I can remember
All of my life/as long as I can remember

variable.name: B2MONTH
variable.description: (Months): what is the longest period of time that this kind of worrying has ever continued? years and months. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of months, -1, -2

variable.name: B2YEARS
variable.description: (Years): what is the longest period of time that this kind of worrying has ever continued? Years and months. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of years, -1, -2

variable.name: B4
variable.description: During that period (when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation), was your worry stronger than in other people? (African American participants)

variable.name: B5
variable.description: Did you worry most days? (African American participants)

variable.name: B6
variable.description: Did you usually worry about one particular thing, such as your job security or the failing health of a loved one, or more than one thing? (African American participants)

variable.name: B7
variable.description: Did you find it difficult to stop worrying? (African American participants)

variable.name: B8
variable.description: Did you ever have different worries on your mind at the same time? (African American participants)

variable.name: B9
variable.description: How often was your worry so strong that you couldn't put it out of your mind no matter how hard you tried? (African American participants)

variable.name: C1A_1
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following things: heights, storms, thunder, lightning, or being in still water, like a swimming pool or lake? (African American participants)

variable.name: C1A_2
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following things: being in a closed space like a cave, tunnel, elevator, or airplane? (African American participants)

variable.name: C1A_3
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following things: snakes, birds, rats, bugs, or other animals? (African American participants)

variable.name: C1A_4
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following things: seeing blood, getting a shot or injection, seeing a dentist, or going to a hospital? (African American participants)

variable.name: C2
variable.description: How often do you get upset when you are in that situation? (African American participants)
variable.value: Only one or two times ever
Only one or two times ever

variable.name: C4
variable.description: How long have you had any of these fears? (African American participants)
variable.value: Less than 1 year (please enter # of months below)

variable.name: C4DATA
variable.description: If C4 (How long have you had any of these fears?) is less than 1 year, please enter # of months. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of months, -1, -2

variable.name: C5
variable.description: How much have any of these fears ever interfered with your life or activities? (African American participants)

variable.name: C6
variable.description: Have you ever been very upset with yourself for having any of these fears? (African American participants)

variable.name: C7
variable.description: Is your fear unreasonable - that is, much stronger than it should be? (African American participants)

variable.name: C8
variable.description: Is your fear much stronger than in other people? (African American participants)

variable.name: COUNT
variable.description: Count of 'yes' answers to A1B (Have you ever had a time in your life lasting two weeks or more when you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure?), A2 (Did you feel more tired out or low on energy than is usual for you?), A3 (Did you gain or lose weight without trying, or did you stay about the same weight?), A4 (Did you have more trouble falling asleep than you usually do?), A5 (Did you have a lot more trouble concentrating than usual?), A6 (People sometimes feel down on themselves, no good, or worthless. Did you feel this way?), and A7 (Did you think a lot about death - either your own, someone else's, or death in general?). (African American participants)
variable.value: Count 1 of 'yes' answer to A1B, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, and A7
Count of 2 'yes' answers to A1B, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, and A7
Count of 3 'yes' answers to A1B, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, and A7
count of 4 'yes' answers to A1B, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, and A7
count of 5 'yes' answers to A1B, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, and A7
count of 6 'yes' answers to A1B, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, and A7
count of 7 'yes' answers to A1B, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, and A7

variable.name: D1_1
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following situations: giving a speech or speaking in public? (African American participants)

variable.name: D1_2
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following situations: eating or drinking where someone could watch you? (African American participants)

variable.name: D1_3
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following situations: talking to people because you might have nothing to say or might sound foolish? (African American participants)

variable.name: D1_4
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following situations: writing while someone watches? (African American participants)

variable.name: D1_5
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following situations: taking part or speaking in a meeting or class? (African American participants)

variable.name: D1_6
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following situations: going to a party or other social outing? (African American participants)

variable.name: D2
variable.description: How often do you get very upset when you are in this situation (unreasonable strong fears)? (African American participants)
variable.value: Only one or two times ever
Only one or two times ever

variable.name: D3
variable.description: How long have you had any of these fears (unreasonable strong fears)? (African American participants)
variable.value: Less than 1 year (please enter # of months below)

variable.name: D3DATA
variable.description: If D3 [How long have you had any of these fears (unreasonable strong fears)?] is less than 1 year, please enter # of months. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of months, -1, -2

variable.name: D4
variable.description: How much have any of these fears (unreasonable strong fears) ever interfered with your life or activities? (African American participants)

variable.name: D5
variable.description: Have you ever been very upset with yourself for having any of these fears (unreasonable strong fears)? (African American participants)

variable.name: D6
variable.description: Is your fear unreasonable - that is, much stronger than it should be? (African American participants)

variable.name: D7
variable.description: Is your fear much stronger than in other people? (African American participants)

variable.name: DSPLY17B
variable.description: Consent (on-line consent form). (African American participants)

variable.name: DSPLY20A
variable.description: Authorization (on-line consent form). (African American participants)

variable.name: E1_1
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear for or avoid any of the following: being in a crowd or standing in line? (African American participants)

variable.name: E1_2
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear for or avoid any of the following: being away from home alone? (African American participants)

variable.name: E1_3
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear for or avoid any of the following: traveling alone? (African American participants)

variable.name: E1_4
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear for or avoid any of the following: traveling in a bus, train, or car? (African American participants)

variable.name: E1_5
variable.description: Do you have an unreasonably strong fear for or avoid any of the following: being in a public place like a department store? (African American participants)

variable.name: E2
variable.description: How often do you get very upset in the situation? (African American participants)
variable.value: Only one or two times ever

variable.name: E4
variable.description: How long have you had any of these fears? (African American participants)
variable.value: Less than 1 year (please enter # of months below)

variable.name: E4DATA
variable.description: If E4 (How long have you had any of these fears?) is less than 1 year, please enter # of months. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of months, -1, -2

variable.name: E5
variable.description: Were you ever afraid that you might faint, lose control, or embarrass yourself in other ways? (African American participants)

variable.name: E6
variable.description: Do you worry that you might be trapped without any way to escape? (African American participants)

variable.name: E7
variable.description: Do you worry that help might not be available if you needed it? (African American participants)

variable.name: E8
variable.description: How much did any of these fears ever interfere with your life or activities? (African American participants)

variable.name: F1
variable.description: Did you ever have a spell or an attack when all of a sudden you felt frightened, anxious, or very uneasy? (African American participants)

variable.name: F1A
variable.description: Did any of these attacks occur when you were in a life-threatening situation? (African American participants)

variable.name: F1B
variable.description: Did any of these attacks occur when you were not in a life-threatening situation? (African American participants)

variable.name: F2
variable.description: About how many attacks have you had in your life? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of attacks, -1, -2

variable.name: F3
variable.description: How long ago did you have the most recent attack? - # months ago (enter 0 if you had one in the past month). (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of months, -1, -2

variable.name: F4
variable.description: Did some of your attacks happen in a situation when you were not in danger or not the center of attention? (African American participants)

variable.name: F5
variable.description: When you have sudden anxiety attacks, do they usually occur in specific situations that cause you unreasonably strong fear? (African American participants)

variable.name: F5A
variable.description: Did you ever have an attack when you were not in a situation that usually causes you to have unreasonably strong fears? (African American participants)

variable.name: F6_1
variable.description: When you have attacks: does your heart pound or race? (African American participants)

variable.name: F6_2
variable.description: When you have attacks: do you have tightness, pain, or discomfort in your chest or stomach? (African American participants)

variable.name: F6_3
variable.description: When you have attacks: do you sweat? (African American participants)

variable.name: F6_4
variable.description: When you have attacks: do you tremble or shake? (African American participants)

variable.name: F6_5
variable.description: When you have attacks: do you have hot flashes or chills? (African American participants)

variable.name: F6_6
variable.description: When you have attacks: do you, or things around you, seem unreal? (African American participants)

variable.name: G1
variable.description: The next questions are about how frequently you drink alcoholic beverages. By a "drink" we mean either: a bottle of beer, a wine cooler, a glass of wine, a shot of liquor, or a mixed drink. With these definitions in mind, what is the largest number of drinks you had in any single day ever? (African American participants)

variable.name: G2
variable.description: Was there ever a time in your life when your drinking or being hung over interfered with: your work at school, or your work at a job, or your home life or housework? (African American participants)

variable.name: G2A
variable.description: How often did drinking interfere with school, job or home life? (African American participants)

variable.name: G3
variable.description: Were you ever under the influence of alcohol in a situation where you could get hurt - like when driving a car or boat, using knives or guns or machinery, or anything else? (African American participants)

variable.name: G4
variable.description: Did you have any emotional or psychological problems from using alcohol - such as feeling uninterested in things, feeling depressed, suspicious of people, paranoid, or having strange ideas? (African American participants)

variable.name: G5
variable.description: Did you have such a strong desire or urge to drink that you could not keep from drinking? (African American participants)

variable.name: G6
variable.description: During that year, did you have a period of a month or more when you spent a great deal of time drinking or getting over the effects of alcohol? (African American participants)

variable.name: G7
variable.description: Did you ever have more to drink than you intended to, or did you drink much longer than you intended to? (African American participants)

variable.name: G7A
variable.description: During that year, how often did you drink more or longer than you intended to? (African American participants)

variable.name: G8
variable.description: During that year, was there ever a time when you had to drink much more than you used to drink, to get the same effect you wanted? (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_1
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Sedatives, including either barbiturates or sleeping pills? (Seconal, Halcion, Methaqualone, etc.). (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_2
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Tranquilizers or "nerve pills"? (Librium, Valium, Ativan, Meprobamate, Xanax, etc.). (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_3
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Amphetamines or other stimulants? (Methamphetamine, Preludin, Dexedrine, Ritalin, "Speed"). (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_4
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Analgesics or other prescription painkillers on your own? (This does NOT include normal use of aspirin, Tylenol without codeine, Advil, etc., but does include use of Tylenol with codeine and other prescription painkillers like Demerol, Darvon, Percodan, Codeine, Morphine, and Methadone). (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_5
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Inhalants that you sniff or breathe to get high or to feel good? (Amylnitrate, Freon, Nitrous Oxide, "Whippets", gasoline, spray paint, etc.). (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_6
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Marijuana or hashish? (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_7
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Cocaine or crack or free base? (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_8
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? LSD or other hallucinogens? (PCP, angeldust, peyote, ecstasy-MDMA, mescaline, etc.). (African American participants)

variable.name: H1_9
variable.description: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" we mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for longer than prescribed. With this definition in mind, did you ever use any of the following drugs on your own? Heroin? (African American participants)

variable.name: H3
variable.description: Did your use of any of these substances ever interfere with: your work at school, or your work at a job, or your home life or housework? (African American participants)

variable.name: H3A
variable.description: How often did using any substances interfere with school, job or home life? (African American participants)

variable.name: H4
variable.description: Were you ever under the influence of any of these substances in a situation where you could get hurt - like when driving a car or boat, using knives or guns or machinery, or anything else? (African American participants)

variable.name: H5
variable.description: Did you have any emotional or psychological problems from using any of these substances - such as feeling uninterested in things, feeling depressed, suspicious of people, paranoid, or having strange ideas? (African American participants)

variable.name: H6
variable.description: Did you have such a strong desire or urge to use any of these substances that you could not keep from using it? (African American participants)

variable.name: H7
variable.description: Did you have a period of a month or more when you spent a great deal of time using any of these substances or getting over their effects? (African American participants)

variable.name: H8
variable.description: Did you ever use any of these substances in much larger amounts, or for a longer period of time, than you intended to? (African American participants)

variable.name: H8A
variable.description: During that year, how often did you use any of these substances more or longer than you intended to? (African American participants)

variable.name: H9
variable.description: Was there ever a time when you had to use more of any of these substances than you used to, to get the same effect you wanted? (African American participants)

variable.name: I1
variable.description: Have you ever been bothered by having certain unpleasant thoughts of your own that kept entering your mind against your wishes? An example would be if you kept having the idea that your hands are dirty or have germs on them. (African American participants)

variable.name: I10
variable.description: Did you have a period when you had to say certain words over and over, either aloud or to yourself? (African American participants)

variable.name: I13
variable.description: Did you think that these actions were unnecessary or that you overdid it? (African American participants)

variable.name: I14
variable.description: Did you tell a doctor about having to do these things? (African American participants)

variable.name: I15
variable.description: Did having to do these things interfere with your life or work, or cause you difficulty with your relatives or friends, or upset you a great deal? (African American participants)

variable.name: I2
variable.description: Another example of an unpleasant thought would if you kept having the idea that you might harm someone, even though you really didn't want to. Or you might have had thoughts you were ashamed of, but couldn't keep out of your mind. Have you ever had any unpleasant and persistent thoughts like that? (African American participants)

variable.name: I3
variable.description: Did some of these thoughts seem to you to be unreasonable? (African American participants)

variable.name: I4
variable.description: Did these thoughts keep coming back again and again into your mind no matter how hard you tried to resist, ignore, or get rid of them? (African American participants)

variable.name: I5
variable.description: Did you ever tell a doctor about these thoughts? (African American participants)

variable.name: I6
variable.description: Did thinking about these ideas interfere with your life or work, or cause you difficulty with your relatives or friends, or upset you a great deal? (African American participants)

variable.name: I7
variable.description: Some people have the unpleasant feeling that they have to do something over and over again even though they know it is foolish, but they can't resist doing it - things like washing their hands again and again or going back several times to be sure they've locked a door or turned off the stove. Have you ever had to do something like that over and over? (African American participants)

variable.name: I8
variable.description: Was there a time when you felt you had to do something in a certain order, like getting dressed perhaps, and had to start all over again if you did it in the wrong order? (African American participants)

variable.name: I9
variable.description: Has there been a period of several weeks when you felt you had to count something, like the squares in a tile floor, and couldn't resist doing it even when you tried to? (African American participants)

variable.name: individual_id
variable.description: Individual identifier: 150 = KN ( the Knowledge Networks web-enabled panel is a method for conducting Internet-based survey research with a U.S. representative probability sample), dash, then five digit ID#. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: 150, dash, then five digit ID

variable.name: M1
variable.description: Have you smoked more than 100 cigarettes in your lifetime? (African American participants)

variable.name: M2
variable.description: Have you ever smoked a whole cigarette? (African American participants)

variable.name: M2A
variable.description: How many cigarettes have you smoked in your lifetime? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of cigarettes, -1, -2

variable.name: M3A
variable.description: Did you smoke cigarettes on a daily basis? (African American participants)

variable.name: M3B
variable.description: How many cigarettes did you smoke on a typical day? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of cigarettes, -1, -2

variable.name: M3C
variable.description: During this time when you smoked the most, how soon after waking did you smoke your first cigarette? (African American participants)

variable.name: M3D
variable.description: Did you find it difficult to refrain from smoking in places where it is forbidden, e.g., in church, at the library, in the cinema, etc.? (African American participants)

variable.name: M3E
variable.description: During this period, which one cigarette would you have hated most to give up? (African American participants)

variable.name: M3F
variable.description: During this period, did you smoke more frequently during the first hours after waking than during the rest of the day? (African American participants)

variable.name: M3G
variable.description: During this period, did you smoke if you are so ill that you are in bed most of the day? (African American participants)

variable.name: M4
variable.description: Do you currently smoke cigarettes? (African American participants)

variable.name: M4A
variable.description: How many cigarettes do you smoke in a typical day? (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of cigarettes, -1, -2

variable.name: M4BMONTH
variable.description: (Months): how long has it been since you quit smoking? Years and months. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of months, -1, -2

variable.name: M4BYEARS
variable.description: (Years): how long has it been since you quit smoking? Years and months. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of years, -1, -2

variable.name: M5
variable.description: Do you consider yourself to be (heterosexual, bisexual, gay or lesbian, I would prefer to not answer this question). (African American participants)
variable.value: I would prefer to not answer this question

variable.name: M6AFEET
variable.description: (Feet): please enter your current height in feet and inches. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of feet, -1, -2

variable.name: M6AGWT
variable.description: What is the greatest weight ever in your life (excluding pregnancy or 6 months after delivery). (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of pounds, -1, -2

variable.name: M6AINCH
variable.description: (Inches): please enter your current height in feet and inches. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of inches, -1, -2

variable.name: M6AWT
variable.description: Please enter below your current weight in pounds. (African American participants)
variable.type: numbers: integer for number of pounds, -1, -2

variable.name: M7GRID_1
variable.description: Have you ever received treatment for, or been diagnosed with, any of the following conditions: schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder. (African American participants)

variable.name: M7GRID_2
variable.description: Have you ever received treatment for, or been diagnosed with, any of the following conditions: hearing voices others could not hear or believing things that others said were not true (such as that people were trying to harm you). (African American participants)

variable.name: M7GRID_3
variable.description: Have you ever received treatment for, or been diagnosed with, any of the following conditions: bipolar disorder (manic-depression). (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_1
variable.description: Does your mood often go up and down? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_10
variable.description: Do you suffer from 'nerves'? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_11
variable.description: Do you often feel lonely? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_12
variable.description: Are you often troubled about feelings of guilt? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_13
variable.description: Are you a talkative person? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_14
variable.description: Are you rather lively? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_15
variable.description: Do you enjoy meeting new people? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_16
variable.description: Can you usually let yourself go and enjoy yourself at a lively party? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_17
variable.description: Do you usually take the initiative in making new friends? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_18
variable.description: Can you easily get some life into a rather dull party? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_19
variable.description: Do you tend to keep in the background on social occasions? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_2
variable.description: Do you ever feel 'just miserable' for no reason? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_20
variable.description: Do you like mixing with people? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_21
variable.description: Do you like plenty of bustle and excitement around you? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_22
variable.description: Are you mostly quiet when you are with other people? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_23
variable.description: Do other people think of you as being very lively? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_24
variable.description: Can you get a party going? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_3
variable.description: Are you an irritable person? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_4
variable.description: Are your feelings easily hurt? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_5
variable.description: Do you often feel 'fed-up'? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_6
variable.description: Would you call yourself a nervous person? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_7
variable.description: Are you a worrier? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_8
variable.description: Would you call yourself tense or 'highly-strung'? (African American participants)

variable.name: NGRID_9
variable.description: Do you worry too long after an embarrassing experience? (African American participants)
